articleData.blog_content:
Some heroes do not wear capes. They wear a helmet and use a bat.


It is the 48th birthday of the living agent. On this day, let us celebrate the most special centuries of the Little Master. 

INDIA vs AUSTRALIA, 9TH SEPTEMBER, 1994

In a magnificent run right at the beginning of his career, Sachin scored a whopping 110 in 130 balls. The young player’s talent was acknowledged and admired by everyone witnessing the match in Colombo. He led the country to victory with his spectacle. 

INDIA vs PAKISTAN, 15th April 1996

When the team was in a crucial need of runs, the little master scored a significant 118 against a strong Pakistan. The match was eased to victory for his magnificent performance. 

INDIA vs AUSTRALIA, 22nd April 1998

Even though the team lost this match, Sachin’s 143 in just 131 balls, hitting nine fours and five sixes, has gone down the memory lane of all cricket lovers. The night at Sharjah was brightened by his spectacular performance. 

INDIA vs SOUTH AFRICA, 17th March 2000

Centuries at home are always extra special. Making a lasting impression on all of us and leading his team to victory, Sachin scored 122 against South Africa at Vadodara. The whole country rejoiced at his performance. 

INDIA vs SOUTH AFRICA, 24th Feb 2010

DOUBLE CENTURY!
When it comes to Sachin, 100 runs may seem easy. But this day at Gwalior, he outdid himself to score a massive 200 runs and staying not out till the end of the match. In just 147 balls, he managed to hit three sixes and twenty five fours! Needless to say, India won and he was declared the man of the match.
